edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.tasks

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.tasks.Query

  • public class Query
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    Query for input to the QueryTask. Not all query properties are required to execute a QueryTask. The query definition requires one of the following properties: queryGeometry, text, or where. Optional properties include outFields, outSpatialReference, and returnGeometry.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Query create()
        Creates a new Query object used to execute a query on the layer resource identified by the URL.
        Returns:
        Query

      • getGeometry

        public final Geometry getGeometry()
        The geometry to apply to the spatial filter. The spatial relationship as specified by spatialRelationship is applied to this geometry while performing the query. The valid geometry types are Extent, Point, Multipoint, Polyline, or Polygon.
        Returns:
        Geometry

      • setGeometry

        public final void setGeometry(Geometry geometry)
        Set the geometry to apply to the spatial filter.
        Parameters:
        geometry - - the geometry to apply to the spatial filter. The spatial relationship as specified by spatialRelationship is applied to this geometry while performing the query. The valid geometry types are Extent, Point, Multipoint, Polyline, or Polygon.

      • getGroupByFieldsForStatistics

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString getGroupByFieldsForStatistics()
        One or more field names that will be used to group the statistics. groupByFieldsForStatistics is only valid when outStatistics have been defined. Requires ArcGIS Server service version 10.1 or greater (As of v2.6)
        Returns:
        JsArrayString

      • setGroupByFieldsForStatistics

        public final void setGroupByFieldsForStatistics(java.lang.String[] groupByFieldsForStatistics)
        Set the groupByFieldsForStatistics parameter.
        Parameters:
        groupByFieldsForStatistics - - One or more field names that will be used to group the statistics. groupByFieldsForStatistics is only valid when outStatistics have been defined. Requires ArcGIS Server service version 10.1 or greater (As of v2.6)

      • getMaxAllowableOffset

        public final double getMaxAllowableOffset()
        The maximum allowable offset used for generalizing geometries returned by the query operation. The offset is in the units of the spatialReference. If a spatialReference is not defined the spatial reference of the map is used.
        Returns:
        double

      • setMaxAllowableOffset

        public final void setMaxAllowableOffset(double maxAllowableOffset)
        Set the maximum allowable offset.
        Parameters:
        maxAllowableOffset - - the maximum allowable offset used for generalizing geometries returned by the query operation. The offset is in the units of the spatialReference. If a spatialReference is not defined the spatial reference of the map is used.

      • getObjectIds

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayInteger getObjectIds()
        A comma delimited list of ObjectIds for the features in the layer/table that you want to query.
        Returns:
        JsArrayInteger

      • setObjectIds

        public final void setObjectIds(int[] ids)
        Set object ids.
        Parameters:
        ids - - Array of ObjectIds for the features in the layer/table that you want to query.

      • getOrderByFields

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString getOrderByFields()
        One or more field names that will be used to order the query results. Specfiy ASC (ascending) or DESC (descending) after the field name to control the order. The default order is ASC. orderByFields is only supported on dynamic layers and tables where supportsAdvancedQueries is true. Requires ArcGIS Server service version 10.1 or greater (As of v2.6)
        Returns:
        JsArrayString

      • setOrderByFields

        public final void setOrderByFields(java.lang.String[] orderByFields)
        Set the orderByField parameter.
        Parameters:
        orderByFields - - One or more field names that will be used to order the query results. Specfiy ASC (ascending) or DESC (descending) after the field name to control the order. The default order is ASC. orderByFields is only supported on dynamic layers and tables where supportsAdvancedQueries is true. Requires ArcGIS Server service version 10.1 or greater (As of v2.6)

      • getOutFields

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString getOutFields()
        Attribute fields to include in the FeatureSet. Fields must exist in the map layer. You must list the actual field names rather than the alias names. Returned fields are also the actual field names. However, you are able to use the alias names when you display the results. You can set field alias names in the map document. When you specify the output fields, you should limit the fields to only those you expect to use in the query or the results. The fewer fields you include, the faster the response will be. Each query must have access to the Shape and Objectid fields for a layer, but your list of fields does not need to include these two fields.
        Returns:
        JsArrayString

      • setOutFields

        public final void setOutFields(java.lang.String[] outFields)
        Set outFields for query.
        Parameters:
        outFields - - Attribute fields to include in the FeatureSet.

      • getOutSpatialReference

        public final SpatialReference getOutSpatialReference()
        The spatial reference for the returned geometry. If not specified, the geometry is returned in the spatial reference of the map.
        Returns:
        SpatialReference

      • setOutSpatialReference

        public final void setOutSpatialReference(SpatialReference outSpatialReference)
        Set the spatial reference for the query.
        Parameters:
        outSpatialReference - - The spatial reference for the returned geometry. If not specified, the geometry is returned in the spatial reference of the map.

      • getOutStatistics

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<StatisticDefinition> getOutStatistics()
        The definitions for one or more field-based statistic to be calculated. outStatistics is only supported on layers/tables where supportsStatistics is true. If outStatistics is specified the only other query parameters that will be used are groupByFieldsForStatistics, orderByFields, text, timeExtent and where. Requires ArcGIS Server service version 10.1 or greater (As of v2.6)
        Returns:
        JsArray

      • setOutStatistics

        public final void setOutStatistics(StatisticDefinition[] outStatistics)
        Set the outStatistics parameter.
        Parameters:
        outStatistics - - The definitions for one or more field-based statistic to be calculated. outStatistics is only supported on layers/tables where supportsStatistics is true. If outStatistics is specified the only other query parameters that will be used are groupByFieldsForStatistics, orderByFields, text, timeExtent and where. Requires ArcGIS Server service version 10.1 or greater (As of v2.6)

      • getRelationParam

        public final java.lang.String getRelationParam()
        The 'Shape Comparison Language' string to evaluate. Examples of valid strings are: RELATE(G1,G2,"FFFTTT***) dim (g1.boundary,g2.boundary) = linear dim (g1.exterior, g2.boundary)= linear The string describes the spatial relationship to be tested when the spatial relationship is esriSpatialRelRelation The Shape Comparison Language EDN topic has additional details.
        Returns:
        String

      • setRelationParam

        public final void setRelationParam(java.lang.String relationParam)
        Set the relation param for this query.
        Parameters:
        relationParam - -The 'Shape Comparison Language' string to evaluate.

      • returnGeometry

        public final boolean returnGeometry()
        If "true", each feature in the FeatureSet includes the geometry. Set to "false" (default) if you do not plan to include highlighted features on a map since the geometry makes up a significant portion of the response.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setReturnGeometry

        public final void setReturnGeometry(boolean returnGeometry)
        Set the returnGeometry parameter for this query.
        Parameters:
        returnGeometry - - If "true", each feature in the FeatureSet includes the geometry. Set to "false" (default) if you do not plan to include highlighted features on a map since the geometry makes up a significant portion of the response.

      • getSpatialRelationship

        public final Query.SpatialRelationshipType getSpatialRelationship()
        The spatial relationship to be applied on the input geometry while performing the query. Default value: SPATIAL_REL_INTERSECTS
        Returns:
        SpatialRelationshipType

      • setSpatialRelationship

        public final void setSpatialRelationship(Query.SpatialRelationshipType spatialRelationship)
        Set the spatial relationship for this query.
        Parameters:
        spatialRelationship - - The spatial relationship to be applied on the input geometry while performing the query.

      • getText

        public final java.lang.String getText()
        Shorthand for a where clause using "like". The field used is the display field defined in the map document. You can determine what the display field is for a layer in Services Directory.
        Returns:
        String

      • setText

        public final void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the text for this query.
        Parameters:
        text - - Shorthand for a where clause using "like". The field used is the display field defined in the map document. You can determine what the display field is for a layer in Services Directory.

      • getTimeExtent

        public final TimeExtent getTimeExtent()

        Returns:
        TimeExtent

      • setTimeExtent

        public final void setTimeExtent(TimeExtent timeExtent)
        Specify a time extent for the query.
        Parameters:
        timeExtent - - time extent to be used in query.

      • getWhere

        public final java.lang.String getWhere()
        A where clause for the query. Any legal SQL where clause operating on the fields in the layer is allowed.
        Returns:
        String

      • setWhere

        public final void setWhere(java.lang.String where)
        Set where clause for this query.
        Parameters:
        where - - A where clause for the query. Any legal SQL where clause operating on the fields in the layer is allowed.
